content:
TITLE: Initializing Outscraper Client in Java
DESCRIPTION: Creates an instance of the OutscraperClient using an API key for authenticating requests to the Outscraper API. This setup is essential before calling any API methods to perform searches or retrieve data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
OutscraperClient client = new OutscraperClient("SECRET_API_KEY");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Outscraper Client in Java
DESCRIPTION: Initializes the OutscraperClient Java object using your secret API key. This client instance is required for making API requests to the Outscraper endpoints. To use, replace "SECRET_API_KEY" with your actual API key obtainable from your Outscraper profile. No additional parameters are necessary for initialization. Ensure the outscraper-java dependency is correctly installed. Returns a client object for subsequent API calls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Google Maps.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
OutscraperClient client = new OutscraperClient("SECRET_API_KEY");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Outscraper Client in Java
DESCRIPTION: Code to create a new instance of the Outscraper client with an API key. A secret API key must be obtained from the Outscraper profile page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Emails And Contacts.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
OutscraperClient client = new OutscraperClient("SECRET_API_KEY");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Outscraper Client in Java
DESCRIPTION: Creates an instance of the OutscraperClient with an API key, necessary for authenticating requests. The API key can be obtained from the Outscraper profile page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Phones Validator.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
OutscraperClient client = new OutscraperClient("SECRET_API_KEY");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Querying Businesses by Location with Outscraper Maps API in Java
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to search for businesses in specific locations using the Outscraper Maps API via the Java SDK. Requires a configured OutscraperClient instance. Key parameters: "query" (location and business type string), "limit" (maximum results), "language" and "region". Returns a JSONArray with the matched business data. Ensure the client is initialized and relevant dependencies for HashMap and JSONArray are present.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Google Maps.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
// Search for businesses in specific locations:
JSONArray results = client.googleMapsSearch(new HashMap<String, Object>() {{
  put("query", "restaurants brooklyn usa");
  put("limit", 20);
  put("language", "en");
  put("region", "us");
}});
System.out.println(results);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Performing Google Maps Search for Businesses with Java
DESCRIPTION: Executes a search query to find businesses in specific locations, limiting results to a specified number. It showcases usage of the 'googleMapsSearch' method with query parameters, returning results as a JSON array.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
JSONArray results = client.googleMapsSearch(new HashMap<String, Object>() {{
    put("query", "bars ny usa");
    put("limit", 10);
}});
System.out.println(results);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Searching Contacts from a Website with Outscraper API in Java
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the emailsAndContacts method to scrape contact information from a specific domain. The query parameter specifies the target website, and results are returned as a JSONArray.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Emails And Contacts.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
# Search contacts from website:
JSONArray results = client.emailsAndContacts(new HashMap<String, Object>() {{
    put("query", "outscraper.com");
}});
System.out.println(results);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using the phonesEnricher method in Java
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to invoke the 'phonesEnricher' method with a query parameter containing the phone number. The method returns a JSONArray with enriched phone data such as carrier info and validation results. The results are printed to the console.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Phones Validator.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
// Get information about the phone number:
JSONArray results = client.phonesEnricher(new HashMap<String, Object>() {{
   put("query", "12812368208");
}});
System.out.println(results);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Data of a Specific Place by ID using Java
DESCRIPTION: Fetches detailed information of a place identified by its ID, specifying language preference. Uses the 'googleMapsSearch' method with a query ID, returning the data as a JSON array.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
JSONArray results = client.googleMapsSearch(new HashMap<String, Object>() {{
    put("query", "rChIJrc9T9fpYwokRdvjYRHT8nI4");
    put("language", "en");
}});
System.out.println(results);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fetching Reviews of a Specific Place by ID with Java
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves reviews for a specific place by its ID, limiting the number of reviews returned. Demonstrates the use of 'googleMapsReviews' method, with output as a JSON array.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
JSONArray results = client.googleMapsReviews(new HashMap<String, Object>() {{
    put("query", "rChIJrc9T9fpYwokRdvjYRHT8nI4");
    put("reviewsLimit", 20);
    put("language", "en");
}});
System.out.println(results);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Querying Business Place by ID with Outscraper Maps API in Java
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates retrieving the data for a specific business or place using its unique Google Maps place ID via the Java SDK. Use the initialized OutscraperClient instance and supply the "query" parameter with the place ID and the desired "language". Returns detailed data for the specified place as a JSONArray. Dependencies required: the Outscraper client and JSON library.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Google Maps.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
// Get data of the specific place by id
JSONArray results = client.googleMapsSearch(new HashMap<String, Object>() {{
  put("query", "ChIJrc9T9fpYwokRdvjYRHT8nI4");
  put("language", "en");
}});
System.out.println(results);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Searching for Contacts and Emails with Java
DESCRIPTION: Uses the 'emailsAndContacts' method to find contact information associated with a domain or website. The example returns a JSON array of results, facilitating contact data extraction.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
JSONArray results = client.emailsAndContacts(new HashMap<String, Object>() {{
    put("query", "outscraper.com");
}});
System.out.println(results);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Gradle for Outscraper Java SDK Installation
DESCRIPTION: Configures the Gradle build system to use the JitPack repository and includes the Outscraper Java SDK as a dependency. Add the provided repository and dependency block to your build.gradle. Requires Gradle and Java 11 or later. Ensures access to the OutscraperClient class for API integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Google Maps.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
repositories {
    maven { url "https://jitpack.io" }
}

dependencies {
    implementation 'com.github.outscraper:outscraper-java:v2.0.0'
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Maven for Outscraper Java SDK Installation
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add the JitPack repository and Outscraper Java SDK dependency to a Maven project. Place the <repositories> and <dependency> blocks in your pom.xml. Requires Maven and Java 11 or later. Enables your Java application to use the Outscraper client and communicate with the Outscraper API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Google Maps.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
	<repositories>
		<repository>
		    <id>jitpack.io</id>
		    <url>https://jitpack.io</url>
		</repository>
	</repositories>
```

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
	<dependency>
	    <groupId>com.github.outscraper</groupId>
	    <artifactId>outscraper-java</artifactId>
	    <version>v2.0.0</version>
	</dependency>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Outscraper Dependency in Maven
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration to add the Outscraper Java library as a dependency in a Maven project, specifying version 2.0.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Emails And Contacts.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.github.outscraper</groupId>
    <artifactId>outscraper-java</artifactId>
    <version>v2.0.0</version>
</dependency>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding JitPack Repository in Maven
DESCRIPTION: XML configuration to add the JitPack repository to a Maven build file, required before adding the Outscraper dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Emails And Contacts.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
<repositories>
	<repository>
	    <id>jitpack.io</id>
	    <url>https://jitpack.io</url>
	</repository>
</repositories>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dependencies setup for Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Defines how to include the Outscraper Java SDK in a Gradle project by adding the JitPack repository and the implementation dependency. Essential for managing SDK installation and updates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Phones Validator.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
repositories {
    maven { url "https://jitpack.io" }
}

dependencies {
    implementation 'com.github.outscraper:outscraper-java:v2.0.0'
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dependencies setup for Maven
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to include the Outscraper Java SDK in a Maven project by adding the JitPack repository and the dependency block in the POM file. This is necessary for dependency resolution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Phones Validator.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<repositories>
	<repository>
		<id>jitpack.io</id>
		<url>https://jitpack.io</url>
	</repository>
</repositories>
```

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.github.outscraper</groupId>
    <artifactId>outscraper-java</artifactId>
    <version>v2.0.0</version>
</dependency>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Outscraper Java Library with Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Configuration snippet for adding the Outscraper Java library as a dependency using Gradle build system. It adds the JitPack repository and specifies the dependency on version 2.0.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Emails And Contacts.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
repositories {
    maven { url "https://jitpack.io" }
}

dependencies {
    implementation 'com.github.outscraper:outscraper-java:v2.0.0'
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Manual JAR installation
DESCRIPTION: Lists the required JAR files to be manually downloaded and added to the project for environments lacking dependency managers, including Outscraper SDK and supporting libraries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/outscraper/outscraper-java/blob/main/examples/Phones Validator.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: none
CODE:
```
- [The Outscraper JAR](https://jitpack.io/com/github/outscraper/outscraper-java/v2.0.0/outscraper-java-v2.0.0.jar)
- [Json](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/json/json/20090211/json-20090211.jar)
- [Httpcomponents](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/httpcomponents/httpclient/4.5.13/httpclient-4.5.13.jar)
- [Guava](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/com/google/guava/guava/30.1.1-jre/guava-30.1.1-jre.jar)
```
